item.description:
We will do a 3.6 mile hike doing an outer loop on some of the Audubon trails around Battery Point.  Depending on what trail/weather conditions are on this day the hike's length may be shortened.  The Audubon's parking lot is plowed in winter and people hike the trails year round.  

Battery Point although it has some hills in places is relatively flat and most of the trails are old fire roads making for wide trails.  So unless just the length of the hike is an issue for you, this is an easy hike. 



Here is a link to a trial map of Battery Point:

http://www.nhmountainhiking.com/hike/massabesic/map_big.jpg

Here is a link to the Massabesic Audubon Center:

http://www.nhaudubon.org/locations/centers/massabesic
item.how_to_find_us: If after parking we gather in the back/overflow parking lot (right behind the first one) the dogs can be off leash without being in any ones way.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Starting the Year Off Right With A New Year's Day Hike
